definition: meal cooked in a large pot/communal meal/(fig.) system that rewards everyone equally regardless of merit
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
pot/pan/boiler/CL:口[kou3],隻|只[zhi1]
cooked rice/CL:碗[wan3]/meal/CL:頓|顿[dun4]/(loanword) fan/devotee
lit. to eat from the common pot (idiom)/fig. to be rewarded the same, regardless of performance

sentences.english: Thus, it can avoid the phenomenon normally called enjoying "the mess".
sentences.chinese: 这样一来就消除了通常称作吃“大锅饭”的局面。

sentences.english: This helps eradicate the practice of eating from the same big pot.
sentences.chinese: 这样一来就消除了通常称作吃“大锅饭”的局面。

sentences.english: Only lazybones and mediocre persons could hanker after the days of messing together.
sentences.chinese: 只有懒汉庸才才会留恋那大锅饭的年代。
